== time based comparison of python-launchpad-bugs and launchpadlib ==

This is still work in progress. python's timeit is used.

=== Preparation ===

==== launchpadlib ====

There are two files with credentials for ''STAGING'' and ''EDGE'', for each mode the connector is created by
<pre>
>>> credentials = Credentials()
>>> credentials.load(open(<file>))
>>> launchpad = Launchpad(credentials, <SERVER-const>)
</pre>

==== python-launchpad-bugs (text) ====

(read-only access)

<pre>
>>> Bug = ConnectBug("text")
>>> Bug.set_connection_mode(<SERVER-const>)
</pre>

==== python-launchpad-bugs (html) ====

(this connection mode is used for write-access)

<pre>
>>> Bug = ConnectBug("html")
>>> Bug.authentication = <cookie-file>
>>> Bug.set_connection_mode(<SERVER-const>)
</pre>

=== Results ===

==== 20080809 ====

===== Versions =====
'''launchpadlib:''' lp:launchpadlib (rev8)

'''python-launchpad-bugs:''' lp:python-launchpad-bugs (rev152)

===== Results =====

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''Task'''
| '''Lib'''
| '''Code'''
| '''STAGING'''
| '''EDGE'''
|-
| <rowspan=2> '''get description of #123456'''
| ''launchpadlib''
| <code> >>> b = launchpad.bugs[123456] </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> print b.description </code>
| 10 loops, best of 3: 2.09 s per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 2.1 s per loop
| 10 loops, best of 3: 2.65 s per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 2.47 s per loop
|-
| <rowbgcolor="lightgreen;"> ''py-lp-bugs (text)''
| <code> >>> b = Bug(123456) </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> print b.description </code>
| 10 loops, best of 3: 638 ms per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 641 ms per loop
| 10 loops, best of 3: 808 ms per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 762 ms per loop
|-
| <rowspan=2> '''get status of all tasks of #123456'''
| ''launchpadlib''
| <code> >>> b = launchpad.bugs[123456] </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> print [t.status for t in b.bug_tasks] </code>
| 10 loops, best of 3: 2.23 s per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 2.28 s per loop
| 10 loops, best of 3: 2.86 s per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 2.69 s per loop
|-
| <rowbgcolor="lightgreen;"> ''py-lp-bugs (text)''
| <code> >>> b = Bug(123456) </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> print [t.status for t in b.infotable] </code>
| 10 loops, best of 3: 641 ms per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 639 ms per loop
| 10 loops, best of 3: 756 ms per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 751 ms per loop
|-
| <rowspan=2> '''change status of first task of #255634'''
| ''py-lp-bugs (html)''
| <code> >>> status_map = {"New": "Invalid", "Invalid": "New"} </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> b = Bug(255634) </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> task = b.infotable[0] </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> task.status = status_map[task.status] </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> b.commit() </code>
| <<BR>>
| 10 loops, best of 3: 6.83 s per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 6.33 s per loop
|-
| <rowbgcolor="lightgreen;"> ''launchpadlib''
| <code> >>> status_map = {"New": "Invalid", "Invalid": "New"} </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> b = launchpad.bugs[255634] </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> task = list(b.bug_tasks)[0] </code> <<BR>> <code> >>> task.transitionToStatus(status=status_map[task.status]) </code>
| <<BR>>
| 10 loops, best of 3: 3.66 s per loop <<BR>> 25 loops, best of 3: 4.51 s per loop
|}

===== Conclusion =====
* for read-only access python-launchpad-bugs in the ''text'' mode is about three times faster than launchpadlib
* write-access with launchpadlib is two times faster than python-launchpad-bugs in the ''html'' mode

==== 20090109 ====

===== Versions =====
'''launchpadlib:''' lp:launchpadlib (rev29)

'''wadllib:''' lp:wadllib (rev6)

'''python-launchpad-bugs:''' lp:python-launchpad-bugs (rev171)

===== Preparations =====

The timings for launchpadlib are now part of the launchpad profile for ipython. To run this timings get the code from `lp:~thekorn/+junk/ipython.launchpad.profile`, copy the profile to `~/.ipython` and run:

<pre>
% LPTIMING=1 ipython -p launchpad  #for staging, or
% LPMODE=edge LPTIMING=1 ipython -p launchpad  #for edge
</pre>
